(Required) The method to use when creating the managed disk. Possible values include:

Import - Import a VHD file in to the managed disk (VHD specified with source_uri).
Empty - Create an empty managed disk.
Copy - Copy an existing managed disk or snapshot (specified with source_resource_id).
FromImage - Copy a Platform Image (specified with image_reference_id)

args.description: (Optional) ID of an existing platform/marketplace disk image to copy when create_option is FromImage.

args.description:
(Optional, Required for a new managed disk) Specifies the size of the managed disk to create in gigabytes.
  If create_option is Copy or FromImage, then the value must be equal to or greater than the source's size.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the virtual machine extension peering. Changing
  this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: location
args.description:
(Required) The location where the extension is created. Changing
  this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: type_handler_version
args.description:
(Required) Specifies the version of the extension to
  use, available versions can be found using the Azure CLI.

args.name: auto_upgrade_minor_version
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies if the platform deploys
  the latest minor version update to the type_handler_version specified.

args.name: settings
args.description:
(Required) The settings passed to the extension, these are
  specified as a JSON object in a string.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the resource group in which to
  create the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be
  created.

args.name: virtual_machine_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the virtual machine. Changing
  this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: publisher
args.description:
(Required) The publisher of the extension, available publishers
  can be found by using the Azure CLI.

args.name: type
args.description:
(Required) The type of extension, available types for a publisher can
  be found using the Azure CLI.

args.name: protected_settings
args.description:
(Optional) The protected_settings passed to the
  extension, like settings, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The Virtual Machine Extension ID.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the virtual machine scale set resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the virtual machine scale set. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: location
args.description: (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: sku
args.description: (Required) A sku block as documented below.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the size of virtual machines in a scale set.

args.name: tier
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the tier of virtual machines in a scale set. Possible values, standard or basic.

args.name: capacity
args.description: (Required) Specifies the number of virtual machines in the scale set.

args.name: upgrade_policy_mode
args.description: (Required) Specifies the mode of an upgrade to virtual machines in the scale set. Possible values, Manual or Automatic.

args.name: overprovision
args.description: (Optional) Specifies whether the virtual machine scale set should be overprovisioned.

args.name: single_placement_group
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies whether the scale set is limited to a single placement group with a maximum size of 100 virtual machines. If set to false, managed disks must be used. Default is true. Changing this forces a
  new resource to be created. See documentation for more information.

args.name: os_profile
args.description: (Required) A Virtual Machine OS Profile block as documented below.

args.name: computer_name_prefix
args.description: (Required) Specifies the computer name prefix for all of the virtual machines in the scale set. Computer name prefixes must be 1 to 9 characters long for windows images and 1 - 58 for linux. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: admin_username
args.description: (Required) Specifies the administrator account name to use for all the instances of virtual machines in the scale set.

args.name: admin_password
args.description: (Required) Specifies the administrator password to use for all the instances of virtual machines in a scale set.

args.name: custom_data
args.description: (Optional) Specifies custom data to supply to the machine. On linux-based systems, this can be used as a cloud-init script. On other systems, this will be copied as a file on disk. Internally, Terraform will base64 encode this value before sending it to the API. The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes.

args.name: source_vault_id
args.description: (Required) Specifies the key vault to use.

args.name: vault_certificates
args.description: (Required, on windows machines) A collection of Vault Certificates as documented below

args.name: provision_vm_agent
args.description: (Optional) Indicates whether virtual machine agent should be provisioned on the virtual machines in the scale set.

args.name: enable_automatic_upgrades
args.description: (Optional) Indicates whether virtual machines in the scale set are enabled for automatic updates.

args.name: winrm
args.description: (Optional) A collection of WinRM configuration blocks as documented below.

args.name: additional_unattend_config
args.description: (Optional) An Additional Unattended Config block as documented below.

args.name: disable_password_authentication
args.description: (Required) Specifies whether password authentication should be disabled. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: ssh_keys
args.description: (Optional) Specifies a collection of path and key_data to be placed on the virtual machine.

args.name: os_profile_secrets
args.description: (Optional) A collection of Secret blocks as documented below.

args.name: os_profile_windows_config
args.description: (Required, when a windows machine) A Windows config block as documented below.

args.name: os_profile_linux_config
args.description: (Required, when a linux machine) A Linux config block as documented below.

args.name: network_profile
args.description: (Required) A collection of network profile block as documented below.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the network interface configuration.

args.name: primary
args.description: (Required) Indicates whether network interfaces created from the network interface configuration will be the primary NIC of the VM.

args.name: ip_configuration
args.description: (Required) An ip_configuration block as documented below

args.name: network_security_group_id
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the identifier for the network security group.

args.name: storage_profile_os_disk
args.description: (Required) A storage profile os disk block as documented below

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the disk name. Must be specified when using unmanaged disk ('managed_disk_type' property not set).

args.name: vhd_containers
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the vhd uri. Cannot be used when image or managed_disk_type is specified.

args.name: managed_disk_type
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the type of managed disk to create. Value you must be either Standard_LRS or Premium_LRS. Cannot be used when vhd_containers or image is specified.

args.name: create_option
args.description: (Required) Specifies how the virtual machine should be created. The only possible option is FromImage.

args.name: caching
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the caching requirements. Possible values include: None (default), ReadOnly, ReadWrite.

args.name: image
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies the blob uri for user image. A virtual machine scale set creates an os disk in the same container as the user image.                 Updating the osDisk image causes the existing disk to be deleted and a new one created with the new image. If the VM scale set is in Manual upgrade mode then the virtual machines are not updated until they have manualUpgrade applied to them.
                 When setting this field `os_type` needs to be specified. Cannot be used when `vhd_containers`, `managed_disk_type` or `storage_profile_image_reference ` are specified.

args.name: os_type
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the operating system Type, valid values are windows, linux.

args.name: storage_profile_data_disk
args.description: (Optional) A storage profile data disk block as documented below

args.name: lun
args.description: (Required) Specifies the Logical Unit Number of the disk in each virtual machine in the scale set.

args.name: create_option
args.description: (Optional) Specifies how the data disk should be created. The only possible options are FromImage and Empty.

args.name: caching
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the caching requirements. Possible values include: None (default), ReadOnly, ReadWrite.

args.name: disk_size_gb
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the size of the disk in GB. This element is required when creating an empty disk.

args.name: managed_disk_type
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the type of managed disk to create. Value must be either Standard_LRS or Premium_LRS.

args.name: storage_profile_image_reference
args.description: (Optional) A storage profile image reference block as documented below.

args.name: id
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies the ID of the (custom) image to use to create the virtual
machine scale set, as in the example below.

args.name: publisher
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the publisher of the image used to create the virtual machines.

args.name: offer
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the offer of the image used to create the virtual machines.

args.name: sku
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the SKU of the image used to create the virtual machines.

args.name: version
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the version of the image used to create the virtual machines.

args.name: extension
args.description: (Optional) Can be specified multiple times to add extension profiles to the scale set. Each extension block supports the fields documented below.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the extension.

args.name: publisher
args.description: (Required) The publisher of the extension, available publishers can be found by using the Azure CLI.

args.name: type
args.description: (Required) The type of extension, available types for a publisher can be found using the Azure CLI.

args.name: type_handler_version
args.description: (Required) Specifies the version of the extension to use, available versions can be found using the Azure CLI.

args.name: auto_upgrade_minor_version
args.description: (Optional) Specifies whether or not to use the latest minor version available.

args.name: settings
args.description: (Required) The settings passed to the extension, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.

args.name: protected_settings
args.description: (Optional) The protected_settings passed to the extension, like settings, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.

args.name: boot_diagnostics
args.description: (Optional) A boot diagnostics profile block as referenced below.

args.name: enabled
args.description: : (Required) Whether to enable boot diagnostics for the virtual machine.

args.name: storage_uri
args.description: : (Required) Blob endpoint for the storage account to hold the virtual machine's diagnostic files. This must be the root of a storage account, and not a storage container.

args.name: plan
args.description: (Optional) A plan block as documented below.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the image from the marketplace.

args.name: publisher
args.description: (Required) Specifies the publisher of the image.

args.name: product
args.description: (Required) Specifies the product of the image from the marketplace.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

args.name: certificate_url
args.description: (Required) It is the Base64 encoding of a JSON Object that which is encoded in UTF-8 of which the contents need to be data, dataType and password.

args.name: certificate_store
args.description: (Required, on windows machines) Specifies the certificate store on the Virtual Machine where the certificate should be added to.

args.name: protocol
args.description: (Required) Specifies the protocol of listener

args.name: certificate_url
args.description: (Optional) Specifies URL of the certificate with which new Virtual Machines is provisioned.

args.name: pass
args.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the pass that the content applies to. The only allowable value is oobeSystem.

args.name: component
args.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the component to configure with the added content. The only allowable value is Microsoft-Windows-Shell-Setup.

args.name: setting_name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the setting to which the content applies. Possible values are: FirstLogonCommands and AutoLogon.

args.name: content
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the base-64 encoded XML formatted content that is added to the unattend.xml file for the specified path and component.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Specifies name of the IP configuration.

args.name: subnet_id
args.description: (Required) Specifies the identifier of the subnet.

args.name: load_balancer_backend_address_pool_ids
args.description: (Optional) Specifies an array of references to backend address pools of load balancers. A scale set can reference backend address pools of one public and one internal load balancer. Multiple scale sets cannot use the same load balancer.

args.name: load_balancer_inbound_nat_rules_ids
args.description: (Optional) Specifies an array of references to inbound NAT rules for load balancers.

args.name: primary
args.description: (Optional) Specifies if this ip_configuration is the primary one.

args.name: accelerated_networking
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies whether to enable accelerated networking or not. Defaults to
false.

args.name: public_ip_address_configuration
args.description:
(Optional) describes a virtual machines scale set IP Configuration's
PublicIPAddress configuration. The public_ip_address_configuration is documented below.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The name of the public ip address configuration

args.name: idle_timeout
args.description: (Required) The idle timeout in minutes. This value must be between 4 and 32.

args.name: domain_name_label
args.description: (Required) The domain name label for the dns settings.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The virtual machine scale set ID.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the Container Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Container Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: location
args.description: (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: ip_address_type
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the ip address type of the container. Public is the only acceptable value at this time. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: dns_label_name
args.description: (Optional) The DNS label/name for the container groups IP.

args.name: os_type
args.description: (Required) The OS for the container group. Allowed values are Linux and Windows. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: restart_policy
args.description: (Optional) Restart policy for the container group. Allowed values are Always, Never, OnFailure. Defaults to Always.

args.name: container
args.description: (Required) The definition of a container that is part of the group as documented in the container block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the Container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: image
args.description: (Required) The container image name. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: cpu
args.description: (Required) The required number of CPU cores of the containers. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: memory
args.description: (Required) The required memory of the containers in GB. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: port
args.description: (Optional) A public port for the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: environment_variables
args.description: (Optional) A list of environment variables to be set on the container. Specified as a map of name/value pairs. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: command
args.description: (Optional) A command line to be run on the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: volume
args.description: (Optional) The definition of a volume mount for this container as documented in the volume block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The name of the volume mount. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: mount_path
args.description: (Required) The path on which this volume is to be mounted. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: read_only
args.description: (Optional) Specify if the volume is to be mounted as read only or not. The default value is false. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: storage_account_name
args.description: (Required) The Azure storage account from which the volume is to be mounted. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: storage_account_key
args.description: (Required) The access key for the Azure Storage account specified as above. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: share_name
args.description: (Required) The Azure storage share that is to be mounted as a volume. This must be created on the storage account specified as above. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The container group ID.

attrs.name: ip_address
attrs.description: The IP address allocated to the container group.

attrs.name: fqdn
attrs.description: The FQDN of the container group derived from dns_name_label.

args.name: name

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the resource group in which to
  create the Container Registry.

args.name: location
args.description: (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: admin_enabled
args.description: (Optional) Specifies whether the admin user is enabled. Defaults to false.

args.name: storage_account_id
args.description: (Required for Classic Sku - Optional otherwise) The ID of a Storage Account which must be located in the same Azure Region as the Container Registry.

args.name: sku
args.description: (Optional) The SKU name of the the container registry. Possible values are Classic (which was previously Basic), Basic, Standard and Premium.

args.name: tags

attrs.name: id

attrs.name: login_server
attrs.description: The URL that can be used to log into the container registry.

attrs.name: admin_username
attrs.description: The Username associated with the Container Registry Admin account - if the admin account is enabled.

attrs.name: admin_password
attrs.description: The Password associated with the Container Registry Admin account - if the admin account is enabled.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the resource group where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: orchestration_platform
args.description: (Required) Specifies the Container Orchestration Platform to use. Currently can be either DCOS, Kubernetes or Swarm. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: master_profile
args.description: (Required) A Master Profile block as documented below.

args.name: count
args.description: (Required) Number of masters (VMs) in the container service cluster. Allowed values are 1, 3, and 5. The default value is 1.

args.name: dns_prefix
args.description: (Required) The DNS Prefix to use for the Container Service master nodes.

args.name: linux_profile
args.description: (Required) A Linux Profile block as documented below.

args.name: admin_username
args.description: (Required) The Admin Username for the Cluster.

args.name: ssh_key

args.name: agent_pool_profile

args.description: (Required) Unique name of the agent pool profile in the context of the subscription and resource group.

args.name: count
args.description: (Required) Number of agents (VMs) to host docker containers. Allowed values must be in the range of 1 to 100 (inclusive). The default value is 1.

args.name: dns_prefix
args.description: (Required) The DNS Prefix given to Agents in this Agent Pool.

args.name: vm_size
args.description: (Required) The VM Size of each of the Agent Pool VM's (e.g. Standard_F1 / Standard_D2v2).

args.name: service_principal
args.description: (only Required when you're using Kubernetes as an Orchestration Platform) A Service Principal block as documented below.

args.name: client_id

args.name: client_secret

args.name: diagnostics_profile

args.name: enabled
args.description: (Required) Should VM Diagnostics be enabled for the Container Service VM's

args.name: tags

args.name: key_data

args.name: dns_prefix

args.name: kubernetes_version
args.description: (Optional) Version of Kubernetes specified when creating the AKS managed cluster.

args.name: linux_profile

args.name: admin_username

args.name: agent_pool_profile

args.name: vm_size

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the CosmosDB Account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which the CosmosDB Account is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: location
args.description: (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: offer_type
args.description: (Required) Specifies the Offer Type to use for this CosmosDB Account - currently this can only be set to Standard.

args.name: kind
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the Kind of CosmosDB to create - possible values are GlobalDocumentDB and MongoDB. Defaults to GlobalDocumentDB. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: consistency_policy
args.description: (Required) Specifies a consistency_policy resource, used to define the consistency policy for this CosmosDB account.

args.name: consistency_level
args.description: (Required) The Consistency Level to use for this CosmosDB Account - can be either BoundedStaleness, Eventual, Session or Strong.

args.name: max_interval_in_seconds
args.description: (Optional) When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the time amount of staleness (in seconds) tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 1 - 100. Defaults to 5. Required when consistency_level is set to BoundedStaleness.

args.name: max_staleness
args.description: (Optional) When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the number of stale requests tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 1 – 2,147,483,647. Defaults to 100. Required when consistency_level is set to BoundedStaleness.

args.name: failover_policy
args.description: (Required) Specifies a failover_policy resource, used to define where data should be replicated.

args.name: location
args.description: (Required) The name of the Azure region to host replicated data.

args.name: priority
args.description: (Required) The failover priority of the region. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions - 1). Failover priority values must be unique for each of the regions in which the database account exists.

args.name: ip_range_filter
args.description: (Optional) CosmosDB Firewall Support: This value specifies the set of IP addresses or IP address ranges in CIDR form to be included as the allowed list of client IP's for a given database account. IP addresses/ranges must be comma separated and must not contain any spaces.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The CosmosDB Account ID.

attrs.name: primary_master_key
attrs.description: The Primary master key for the CosmosDB Account.

attrs.name: secondary_master_key
attrs.description: The Secondary master key for the CosmosDB Account.

attrs.name: primary_readonly_master_key
attrs.description: The Primary read-only master Key for the CosmosDB Account.

attrs.name: secondary_readonly_master_key
attrs.description: The Secondary read-only master key for the CosmosDB Account.

  or premium vault.

(Required) The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be
  used for authenticating requests to the key vault.

args.name: access_policy
args.description:
(Required) An access policy block as described below. At least
  one policy is required up to a maximum of 16.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Required) The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used
  for authenticating requests to the key vault. Must match the tenant_id used
  above.

args.name: object_id
args.description:
(Required) The object ID of a user, service principal or security
  group in the Azure Active Directory tenant for the vault. The object ID must
  be unique for the list of access policies.

args.name: application_id
args.description: (Optional) The object ID of an Application in Azure Active Directory.

args.name: certificate_permissions
args.description:
(Optional) List of certificate permissions, must be one or more from
  the following: create, delete, deleteissuers, get, getissuers, import, list, listissuers, managecontacts, manageissuers, purge, recover, setissuers and update.

args.name: key_permissions
args.description:
(Required) List of key permissions, must be one or more from
  the following: backup, create, decrypt, delete, encrypt, get, import, list, purge, recover, restore, sign, unwrapKey, update, verify and wrapKey.

args.name: secret_permissions
args.description:
(Required) List of secret permissions, must be one or more
  from the following: backup, delete, get, list, purge, recover, restore and set.

args.name: enabled_for_deployment
args.description:
(Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether Azure Virtual
  Machines are permitted to retrieve certificates stored as secrets from the key
  vault. Defaults to false.

args.name: enabled_for_disk_encryption
args.description:
(Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether Azure
  Disk Encryption is permitted to retrieve secrets from the vault and unwrap keys.
  Defaults to false.

args.name: enabled_for_template_deployment
args.description:
(Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether
  Azure Resource Manager is permitted to retrieve secrets from the key vault.
  Defaults to false.

args.name: protocol
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the protocol of the end point. Possible values are Http or Tcp. If Tcp is specified, a received ACK is required for the probe to be successful. If Http is specified, a 200 OK response from the specified URI is required for the probe to be successful.

args.name: port
args.description: (Required) Port on which the Probe queries the backend endpoint. Possible values range from 1 to 65535, inclusive.

args.name: request_path
args.description: (Optional) The URI used for requesting health status from the backend endpoint. Required if protocol is set to Http. Otherwise, it is not allowed.

args.name: interval_in_seconds
args.description: (Optional) The interval, in seconds between probes to the backend endpoint for health status. The default value is 15, the minimum value is 5.

args.name: number_of_probes
args.description: (Optional) The number of failed probe attempts after which the backend endpoint is removed from rotation. The default value is 2. NumberOfProbes multiplied by intervalInSeconds value must be greater or equal to 10.Endpoints are returned to rotation when at least one probe is successful.

args.description:
(Optional) Boolean flag which controls whether to enable
  the queue to be partitioned across multiple message brokers. Changing this forces
  a new resource to be created. Defaults to false for Basic and Standard. For Premium, it MUST
  be set to true.

args.name: lock_duration
args.description: (Optional) The ISO 8601 timespan duration of a peek-lock; that is, the amount of time that the message is locked for other receivers. Maximum value is 5 minutes. Defaults to 1 minute. (PT1M)

args.name: max_size_in_megabytes
args.description:
(Optional) Integer value which controls the size of
  memory allocated for the queue. For supported values see the "Queue/topic size"
  section of this document.

args.name: requires_duplicate_detection
args.description:
(Optional) Boolean flag which controls whether
  the Queue requires duplicate detection. Changing this forces
  a new resource to be created. Defaults to false.

args.name: namespace_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the ServiceBus Namespace to create
  this queue in. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: location
args.description:
(Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists.
  Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the resource group in which to
  create the namespace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: auto_delete_on_idle
args.description:
(Optional) The idle interval after which the
  Queue is automatically deleted, minimum of 5 minutes. Provided in the TimeSpan
  format.

args.name: default_message_ttl
args.description:
(Optional) The TTL of messages sent to this queue. This is the default value
  used when TTL is not set on message itself. Provided in the TimeSpan
  format.

args.name: duplicate_detection_history_time_window
args.description:
(Optional) The duration during which
  duplicates can be detected. Default value is 10 minutes. Provided in the TimeSpan format.

args.name: enable_express
args.description:
(Optional) Boolean flag which controls whether Express Entities
  are enabled. An express queue holds a message in memory temporarily before writing
  it to persistent storage. Defaults to false for Basic and Standard. For Premium, it MUST
  be set to false.

args.name: probe

Http
Https

args.description: (Required) Relative path of probe. Valid path starts from '/'. Probe is sent to {Protocol}://{host}:{port}{path}. The port used will be the same port as defined in the backend_http_settings.

args.description: (Required) Host name to send probe to. If Application Gateway is configured for a single site, by default the Host name should be specified as ‘127.0.0.1’, unless otherwise configured in custom probe.

args.description: (Required) Probe interval in seconds. This is the time interval between two consecutive probes. Minimum 1 second and Maximum 86,400 secs.

args.description: (Required) Probe retry count. Backend server is marked down after consecutive probe failure count reaches UnhealthyThreshold. Minimum 1 second and Maximum 20.

  values between 1 and 1000, with no Endpoints sharing the same value. If
  omitted the value will be computed in order of creation.

args.name: endpoint_location
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies the Azure location of the Endpoint,
  this must be specified for Profiles using the Performance routing method
  if the Endpoint is of either type nestedEndpoints or externalEndpoints.
  For Endpoints of type azureEndpoints the value will be taken from the
  location of the Azure target resource.

args.name: min_child_endpoints
args.description:
(Optional) This argument specifies the minimum number
  of endpoints that must be ‘online’ in the child profile in order for the
  parent profile to direct traffic to any of the endpoints in that child
  profile. This argument only applies to Endpoints of type nestedEndpoints
  and defaults to 1.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The Traffic Manager Endpoint id.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the virtual network. Changing this forces a
  new resource to be created.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the resource group in which to
  create the virtual network.

args.name: profile_status
args.description:
(Optional) The status of the profile, can be set to either
  Enabled or Disabled. Defaults to Enabled.

args.name: traffic_routing_method
args.description:
(Required) Specifies the algorithm used to route
  traffic, possible values are:

Performance- Traffic is routed via the User's closest Endpoint
Weighted - Traffic is spread across Endpoints proportional to their
  weight value.
Priority - Traffic is routed to the Endpoint with the lowest
  priority value.

args.name: dns_config
args.description:
(Required) This block specifies the DNS configuration of the
  Profile, it supports the fields documented below.

args.name: relative_name
args.description:
(Required) The relative domain name, this is combined with
  the domain name used by Traffic Manager to form the FQDN which is exported
  as documented below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: ttl
args.description:
(Required) The TTL value of the Profile used by Local DNS resolvers
  and clients.

args.name: monitor_config
args.description:
(Required) This block specifies the Endpoint monitoring
  configuration for the Profile, it supports the fields documented below.

args.name: protocol
args.description:
(Required) The protocol used by the monitoring checks, supported
  values are HTTP, HTTPS and `TCP``.

args.name: port
args.description: (Required) The port number used by the monitoring checks.

args.name: path
args.description: (Optional) The path used by the monitoring checks. Required when protocol is set to HTTP or HTTPS - cannot be set when protocol is set to TCP.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The Traffic Manager Profile id.

attrs.name: fqdn
attrs.description: The FQDN of the created Profile.

args.name: address_space
args.description:
(Required) The address space that is used the virtual
  network. You can supply more than one address space. Changing this forces
  a new resource to be created.

args.name: location

(Required) The location/region where the virtual network is
  created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: dns_servers
args.description: (Optional) List of IP addresses of DNS servers

args.name: subnet

args.name: name

args.name: address_prefix

args.name: security_group

(Optional) The Network Security Group to associate with
  the subnet. (Referenced by id, ie. azurerm_network_security_group.test.id)

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the Virtual Network Gateway. Changing the name
  forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the resource group in which to
  create the Virtual Network Gateway. Changing the resource group name forces
  a new resource to be created.

args.name: location
args.description:
(Required) The location/region where the Virtual Network Gateway is
  located. Changing the location/region forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: type
args.description:
(Required) The type of the Virtual Network Gateway. Valid options are
  Vpn or ExpressRoute. Changing the type forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: vpn_type
args.description:
(Optional) The routing type of the Virtual Network Gateway. Valid
  options are RouteBased or PolicyBased. Defaults to RouteBased.

args.name: enable_bgp
args.description:
(Optional) If true, BGP (Border Gateway Protocol) will be enabled
  for this Virtual Network Gateway. Defaults to false.

args.name: active_active
args.description:
(Optional) If true, an active-active Virtual Network Gateway
  will be created. An active-active gateway requires a HighPerformance or an
  UltraPerformance sku. If false, an active-standby gateway will be created.
  Defaults to false.

args.name: default_local_network_gateway_id
args.description:
(Optional) The ID of the local network gateway
  through which outbound Internet traffic from the virtual network in which the
  gateway is created will be routed (forced tunneling). Refer to the
  Azure documentation on forced tunneling.
  If not specified, forced tunneling is disabled.

args.name: sku
args.description:
(Required) Configuration of the size and capacity of the virtual network
  gateway. Valid options are Basic, Standard, HighPerformance, UltraPerformance,
  VpnGw1, VpnGw2 and VpnGw3 and depend on the type and vpn_type arguments.
  A PolicyBased gateway only supports the Basic sku. Further, the UltraPerformance
  sku is only supported by an ExpressRoute gateway.

args.name: ip_configuration
args.description:
(Required) One or two ip_configuration blocks documented below.
  An activestandby gateway requires exactly one ip_configuration block whereas
  an active-active gateway requires exactly two ip_configuration blocks.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) A user-defined name of the IP configuration. Defaults to
  vnetGatewayConfig.

args.name: private_ip_address_allocation
args.description:
(Optional) Defines how the private IP address
  of the gateways virtual interface is assigned. Valid options are Static or
  Dynamic. Defaults to Dynamic.

args.name: subnet_id
args.description:
(Required) The ID of the gateway subnet of a virtual network in
  which the virtual network gateway will be created. It is mandatory that
  the associated subnet is named GatewaySubnet. Therefore, each virtual
  network can contain at most a single Virtual Network Gateway.

args.name: public_ip_address_id
args.description:
(Optional) The ID of the public ip address to associate
  with the Virtual Network Gateway.

args.name: vpn_client_configuration
args.description:
(Optional) A vpn_client_configuration block which
  is documented below. In this block the Virtual Network Gateway can be configured
  to accept IPSec pointto-site connections.

args.name: address_space
args.description:
(Required) The address space out of which ip addresses for
  vpn clients will be taken. You can provide more than one address space, e.g.
  in CIDR notation.

args.name: root_certificate
args.description:
(Required) One or more root_certificate blocks which are
  defined below. These root certificates are used to sign the client certificate
  used by the VPN clients to connect to the gateway.

args.name: revoked_certificate
args.description:
(Optional) One or more revoked_certificate blocks which
  are defined below.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

args.name: asn
args.description: (Optional) The Autonomous System Number (ASN) to use as part of the BGP.

args.name: peering_address
args.description:
(Optional) The BGP peer IP address of the virtual network
  gateway. This address is needed to configure the created gateway as a BGP Peer
  on the on-premises VPN devices. The IP address must be part of the subnet of
  the Virtual Network Gateway.

args.name: peer_weight
args.description:
(Optional) The weight added to routes which have been learned
  through BGP peering. Valid values can be between 0 and 100.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) A user-defined name of the root certificate.

args.name: public_cert_data
args.description:
(Required) The public certificate of the root certificate
  authority. The certificate must be provided in Base-64 encoded X.509 format
  (PEM). In particular, this argument must not include the
  -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- or -----END CERTIFICATE----- markers.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) A user-defined name of the revoked certificate.

args.name: public_cert_data
args.description:
(Required) The SHA1 thumbprint of the certificate to be
  revoked.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The ID of the Virtual Network Gateway.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the connection. Changing the name forces a
  new resource to be created.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the resource group in which to
  create the connection Changing the name forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: location
args.description:
(Required) The location/region where the connection is
  located. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: type
args.description:
(Required) The type of connection. Valid options are IPsec
  (Site-to-Site), ExpressRoute (ExpressRoute), and Vnet2Vnet (VNet-to-VNet).
  Each connection type requires different mandatory arguments (refer to the
  examples above). Changing the connection type will force a new connection
  to be created.

args.name: virtual_network_gateway_id
args.description:
(Required) The ID of the Virtual Network Gateway
  in which the connection will be created. Changing the gateway forces a new
  resource to be created.

args.name: authorization_key
args.description:
(Optional) The authorization key associated with the
  Express Route Circuit. This field is required only if the type is an
  ExpressRoute connection.

args.name: express_route_circuit_id
args.description:
(Optional) The ID of the Express Route Circuit
  when creating an ExpressRoute connection (i.e. when type is ExpressRoute).
  The Express Route Circuit can be in the same or in a different subscription.

args.name: peer_virtual_network_gateway_id
args.description:
(Optional) The ID of the peer virtual
  network gateway when creating a VNet-to-VNet connection (i.e. when type
  is Vnet2Vnet). The peer Virtual Network Gateway can be in the same or
  in a different subscription.

args.name: local_network_gateway_id
args.description:
(Optional) The ID of the local network gateway
  when creating Site-to-Site connection (i.e. when type is IPsec).

args.name: routing_weight
args.description: (Optional) The routing weight. Defaults to 10.

args.name: shared_key
args.description:
(Optional) The shared IPSec key. A key must be provided if a
  Site-to-Site or VNet-to-VNet connection is created whereas ExpressRoute
  connections do not need a shared key.

args.name: enable_bgp
args.description:
(Optional) If true, BGP (Border Gateway Protocol) is enabled
  for this connection. Defaults to false.

args.name: use_policy_based_traffic_selectors
args.description:
(Optional) If true, policy-based traffic
  selectors are enabled for this connection. Enabling policy-based traffic
  selectors requires an ipsec_policy block. Defaults to false.

args.name: ipsec_policy
args.description:
(Optional) A ipsec_policy block which is documented below.
  Only a single policy can be defined for a connection. For details on
  custom policies refer to the relevant section in the Azure documentation.

args.name: dh_group
args.description:
(Required) The DH group used in IKE phase 1 for initial SA. Valid
  options are DHGroup1, DHGroup14, DHGroup2, DHGroup2048, DHGroup24,
  ECP256, ECP384, or None.

args.name: ike_encryption
args.description:
(Required) The IKE encryption algorithm. Valid
  options are AES128, AES192, AES256, DES, or DES3.

args.name: ike_integrity
args.description:
(Required) The IKE integrity algorithm. Valid
  options are MD5, SHA1, SHA256, or SHA384.

args.name: ipsec_encryption
args.description:
(Required) The IPSec encryption algorithm. Valid
  options are AES128, AES192, AES256, DES, DES3, GCMAES128, GCMAES192, GCMAES256, or None.

args.name: ipsec_integrity
args.description:
(Required) The IPSec integrity algorithm. Valid
  options are GCMAES128, GCMAES192, GCMAES256, MD5, SHA1, or SHA256.

args.name: pfs_group
args.description:
(Required) The DH group used in IKE phase 2 for new child SA.
  Valid options are ECP256, ECP384, PFS1, PFS2, PFS2048, PFS24,
  or None.

args.name: sa_datasize
args.description:
(Optional) The IPSec SA payload size in KB. Must be at least
  1024 KB. Defaults to 102400000 KB.

args.name: sa_lifetime
args.description:
(Optional) The IPSec SA lifetime in seconds. Must be at least
  300 seconds. Defaults to 27000 seconds.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The connection ID.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the virtual network peering. Changing this
  forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: virtual_network_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the virtual network. Changing
  this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: remote_virtual_network_id
args.description:
(Required) The full Azure resource ID of the
  remote virtual network.  Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the resource group in which to
  create the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be
  created.

args.name: allow_virtual_network_access
args.description:
(Optional) Controls if the VMs in the remote
  virtual network can access VMs in the local virtual network. Defaults to
  false.

args.name: allow_forwarded_traffic
args.description:
(Optional) Controls if forwarded traffic from  VMs
  in the remote virtual network is allowed. Defaults to false.

args.name: allow_gateway_transit
args.description:
(Optional) Controls gatewayLinks can be used in the
  remote virtual network’s link to the local virtual network.

args.name: use_remote_gateways
args.description:
(Optional) Controls if remote gateways can be used on
  the local virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and
  allowGatewayTransit on the remote peering is also true, virtual network will
  use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can
  have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network
  already has a gateway. Defaults to false.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The Virtual Network Peering resource ID.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the Log Analytics Workspace. Workspace name should include 4-63 letters, digits or '-'. The '-' shouldn't be the first or the last symbol. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which the Log Analytics workspace is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: location

args.name: sku
args.description: (Required) Specifies the Sku of the Log Analytics Workspace. Possible values are Free, PerNode, Premium, Standard, Standalone and Unlimited.

args.name: retention_in_days
args.description: (Optional) The workspace data retention in days. Possible values range between 30 and 730.

args.name: shard_count

args.name: redis_configuration

args.name: maxmemory_reserve

args.name: maxmemory_delta

args.name: maxmemory_policy
args.description: (Optional) How Redis will select what to remove when maxmemory is reached. Defaults are shown below.

args.name: rdb_backup_enabled
args.description: (Optional) Is Backup Enabled? Only supported on Premium SKU's.

args.name: rdb_backup_frequency
args.description: (Optional) The Backup Frequency in Minutes. Only supported on Premium SKU's. Possible values are: 15, 30, 60, 360, 720 and 1440.

args.name: rdb_backup_max_snapshot_count
args.description: (Optional) The maximum number of snapshots to create as a backup. Only supported for Premium SKU's.

args.name: rdb_storage_connection_string

In the format: DefaultEndpointsProtocol=https;BlobEndpoint=${azurerm_storage_account.test.primary_blob_endpoint};AccountName=${azurerm_storage_account.test.name};AccountKey=${azurerm_storage_account.test.primary_access_key}.

  not just within the resource group.

args.name: resource_group_name

(Required) The name of the resource group in which to
  create the storage account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: location

(Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the
  resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: account_kind
args.description:
(Optional) Defines the Kind of account. Valid options are Storage
  and BlobStorage. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Defaults

args.name: account_tier

args.name: account_replication_type

args.name: source_uri
args.description:
(Optional) The URI of an existing blob, or a file in the Azure File service, to use as the source contents
  for the blob to be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Cannot be defined if source is defined.

args.name: parallelism
args.description: (Optional) The number of workers per CPU core to run for concurrent uploads. Defaults to 8.

args.name: attempts
args.description: (Optional) The number of attempts to make per page or block when uploading. Defaults to 1.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The storage blob Resource ID.

attrs.name: url
attrs.description: The URL of the blob

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The name of the storage queue. Must be unique within the storage account the queue is located.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the resource group in which to
  create the storage queue. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: storage_account_name
args.description:
(Required) Specifies the storage account in which to create the storage queue.
Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The storage queue Resource ID.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The name of the share. Must be unique within the storage account where the share is located.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the resource group in which to
  create the share. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: storage_account_name
args.description:
(Required) Specifies the storage account in which to create the share.
Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: quota
args.description: (Optional) The maximum size of the share, in gigabytes. Must be greater than 0, and less than or equal to 5 TB (5120 GB). Default this is set to 0 which results in setting the quota to 5 TB.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The storage share Resource ID.

attrs.name: url
attrs.description: The URL of the share

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The name of the storage table. Must be unique within the storage account the table is located.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the resource group in which to
  create the storage table. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

args.name: storage_account_name
args.description:
(Required) Specifies the storage account in which to create the storage table.
Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The storage table Resource ID.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) Specifies the name of the template deployment. Changing this forces a
  new resource to be created.

args.name: resource_group_name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the resource group in which to
  create the template deployment.

args.name: deployment_mode
args.description:
(Required) Specifies the mode that is used to deploy resources. This value could be either Incremental or Complete.
  Note that you will almost always want this to be set to Incremental otherwise the deployment will destroy all infrastructure not
  specified within the template, and Terraform will not be aware of this.

args.name: template_body
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the JSON definition for the template.

args.name: parameters
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the name and value pairs that define the deployment parameters for the template.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The Template Deployment ID.

attrs.name: outputs
attrs.description: A map of supported scalar output types returned from the deployment (currently, Azure Template Deployment outputs of type String, Int and Bool are supported, and are converted to strings - others will be ignored) and can be accessed using .outputs["name"].
